serverSide

Class ClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • serverSide.ClientHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.Observer

    public class ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.util.Observer
    Version:
    1.0 Class Description: Represents a ClientHandler object that (acts like a server) and handles communication between two clients.
    Author:
    Floyd Almazar

      ClientHandler(java.net.Socket cs1, java.net.Socket cs2)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientHandler

        public ClientHandler(java.net.Socket cs1,
                     java.net.Socket cs2)
        Method that opens up data streams for the two clients/players so they can communicate with one another.
        Parameters:
        cs1 - - socket of the 1st Player
        cs2 - - socket of the 2nd Player

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Method that creates an listeners for the two clients and gets the messages that came from them. At first, it creates its own system message that assigns its player number randomly. It closes once the connection of one client has been disconnected from the server.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable observable,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        Method that is called whenever a message comes in. This method then distributes the message to their opponent/other listener.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
